codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96782

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSTESTCD

datasetVariables.description:
Short name of the TEST in RSTEST. RSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TRGRESP", "NTRGRESP", "OVRLRESP", "SYMPTDTR", "CPS0102".
There are separate codelists used for RSTESTCD where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTSCD" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: TRGRESP, "NTRGRESP, "OVRLRESSP". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists.
datasetVariables.label: Assessment Short Name
datasetVariables.name: RSTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96781

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSTEST

datasetVariables.description:
Verbatim name of the response assessment. The value in RSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
There are separate codelists used for RSTEST where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTS" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: "Target Response", "Non-target Response", "Overall Response", "Symptomatic Deterioration", "CPS01-Ascites". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists. For Clinical Classifications, QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists.
datasetVariables.label: Assessment Name
datasetVariables.name: RSTEST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C118971
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C124298

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSCAT

datasetVariables.description:
Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "RECIST 1.1", "CHILD-PUGH CLASSIFICATION". There are separate codelists used for RSCAT where the choice depends on whether the related records are about an oncology response criterion or another clinical classification.
RSCAT is required for clinical classifications other than oncology response criteria.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Assessment
datasetVariables.name: RSCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of RSCAT values.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory
datasetVariables.name: RSSCAT

priorVersion.title: Response Assessment Result in Std Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTRESC

datasetVariables.description:
Contains the result value for the response assessment, copied, or derived from RSORRES in a standard format or standard units. RSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format.
For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: RSSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: RSSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized units used for RSSTRESC and RSSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: RSSTRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate the response assessment was not performed. Should be null if a result exists in RSORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: RSSTAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why a response assessment was not performed. Examples: "All target tumors not evaluated", "Subject does not have non-target tumors". Used in conjunction with RSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: RSREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSNAM

datasetVariables.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the response assessment. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Vendor Name
datasetVariables.name: RSNAM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSLOBXFL

datasetVariables.description:
Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
When a clinical classification is assessed at multiple times, including baseline, RSLOBXFL should be included in the dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: RSLOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that --BLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: RSBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: RSDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSEVAL

datasetVariables.description:
Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from one or more independent assessors is included, meaning that the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: RSEVAL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSEVALID

datasetVariables.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in RSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See RS Assumption 9.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: RSEVALID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSACPTFL

datasetVariables.description: In cases where more than one independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATOR") provides an evaluation of response, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted evaluation.
datasetVariables.label: Accepted Record Flag
datasetVariables.name: RSACPTFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See RSTPTNUM and RSTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: RSTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSTPTNUM

datasetVariables.name: RSTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RSTPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: RSELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RSELTM, RSTPTNUM, and RSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: RSTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RSTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RSRFTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSEVLINT

datasetVariables.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding RSTESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
datasetVariables.name: RSEVLINT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSEVINTX

datasetVariables.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval Text
datasetVariables.name: RSEVINTX

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTRTPT

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.description:
Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSSTTPT.
Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RSSTRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
datasetVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RSSTTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.description:
Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSENTPT.
Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RSENRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSENTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RSENTPT

description: A findings domain for the assessment of disease response to therapy, or clinical classification based on published criteria. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C107097, 2018-06-29)
label: Disease Response and Clin Classification
name: RS
